model

Class Model

  • java.lang.Object
    • model.Model

  • public class Model
extends java.lang.Object
    The Model handles most of the logic in the application, creating shapes and adding them to the pane. selecting shapes, saving the image, and so on.

      • createShape

        public javafx.scene.shape.Shape createShape(java.lang.String shapeName,
                                            javafx.scene.paint.Paint fill,
                                            javafx.scene.paint.Paint border)
        Creates a shape based on the controller's input of name, fill, and border
        Parameters:
        shapeName - the name of the created shape
        fill - the fill color of the created shape
        border - the border color of the created shape
        Returns:
        the shape created

      • addShapeToPane

        public void addShapeToPane(java.lang.String shapeName,
                           javafx.scene.paint.Paint border,
                           javafx.scene.paint.Paint fill,
                           javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent event,
                           javafx.scene.layout.Pane pane)
        adds the specified shape to the pane with 0 initial dimensions.
        Parameters:
        shapeName - the name of the shape that is added to the pane
        border - the border of the shape that is added to the pane
        fill - the fill color of the shape that is added to the pane
        event - a MouseEvent to indicate where is the starting point of the shape
        pane - the pane onto which the shape will be added.

      • drawShape

        public void drawShape(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent event,
                      javafx.scene.shape.Shape shape)
        Draws the shape according to its implementation of the draw method
        Parameters:
        event - a MouseEvent to extract the current location of the mouse.
        shape - the shape to be drawn.
        See Also:
        Drawable

        Parameters:

        context - the GraphicContext of the canvas
        strokeColor - the brush color that will be used.

      • bindPropertyToShape

        public void bindPropertyToShape(javafx.beans.property.StringProperty width,
                                javafx.beans.property.StringProperty height,
                                javafx.scene.shape.Shape shape)
        Binds the shape width and height properties to the TextField's StringProperty. Enables real-time viewing and editing of the shape's properties
        Parameters:
        width - the StringProperty of the width TextField
        height - the StringProperty of the height TextField
        shape - the shape to be binded with the TextField's properties

      • deSelectShape

        public void deSelectShape()
        deselects the current shape selected

      • attachBoundingRectangle

        public void attachBoundingRectangle(javafx.scene.Node node)
        Attaches a Bounds node to the selected shape
        Parameters:
        node - the node to be bounded (defaultValue: selectedShape)
        See Also:
        Bounds

      • copyShape

        public void copyShape(javafx.scene.shape.Shape shape,
                      javafx.scene.layout.Pane pane)
        Copies the shape passed to this method. The copied shape is saved in the model
        Parameters:
        shape - the shape to be copied
        pane - the pane where the shape is located

      • cutShape

        public void cutShape(javafx.scene.shape.Shape shape,
                     javafx.scene.layout.Pane pane)
        Copies and deletes the shape passed to this method. The copied shape is saved in the model
        Parameters:
        shape - the shape to be copied and deleted
        pane - the pane wher ethe shape is located

      • pasteShape

        public void pasteShape(javafx.scene.shape.Shape shape,
                       javafx.scene.layout.Pane pane)
                throws java.lang.Exception
        A wrapper method for the duplicateShape method. This method is solely made for consistency with the controller naming scheme
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
        See Also:
        Model.duplicateShape

        deletes all the shapes in the pane.

      • save

        public void save(javafx.scene.layout.Pane pane)
        saves all of the pane's contents as an image. This includes the canvas and all of the shapes
        Parameters:
        pane - the pane to be saved

      • load

        public void load(javafx.scene.layout.Pane pane,
                 javafx.scene.canvas.Canvas canvas)

                           javafx.scene.layout.Pane pane)
                    throws java.lang.Exception
        Adds an exact copy of a shape to the pane at a location relative to the shape
        Parameters:
        selectedShape - the shape to be duplicated
        pane - the pane where the shape is located
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • undo

        public void undo(javafx.scene.layout.Pane pane,
                 javafx.scene.canvas.Canvas canvas)
        loads the previous State object. and adds its shapes to the pane after clearing it, and prints its image to the canvas
        Parameters:
        pane - the pane to be Undoed
        canvas - the canvas to be cleared and redrawn
        See Also:
        State

      • saveState

        public void saveState(javafx.scene.layout.Pane pane,
                      javafx.scene.canvas.Canvas canvas)
        creates a new State object from the current pane and canvas, and pushes it to the state stack.
        Parameters:
        pane - the pane which will get its objects saved onto State
        canvas - the canvas which will get its image saved onto State
        See Also:
        State, Model.undo
